utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And can I get your name again?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Jeanne as in J E A N N E.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You are Julie, J U L I E, is that right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh may I know %uh when are you intending to come to Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well I'm planning to go to Singapore next month.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And how long are you staying?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'll be staying there for two days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh do you intend to come alone or do you have %uh people coming with you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh I'll just travel with my best friend.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a male or a female, may I ask?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and %uh may I just know your age range?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, we love hanging out or going around the city.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And it's okay if we just walk around the city.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And if you have beaches or probably just some resorts.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have beaches %uh on the island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we also have an island called Sentosa that you can go to.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh when you talk about hanging out, what do you mean actually?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh we love going to the mall and bar hopping.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh drink coffee in between your shopping.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh have you been to Singapore before?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's why we're really excited to go there next month.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I want to make the most of the vacation so that's why I'm calling you so that- I hope that you could help me out.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh let me show you- I think you sound quite independent.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Shall I show you the %uh Mass Rapid Transit System?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that when you arrive, you can take the train-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: to go to- from the airport into town the fastest way and %uh very efficient.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That stands for Mass Rapid Transit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me show you the map so you can see the whole of Singapore also.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh where are you intending to stay? Uh

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh where are you intending to stay? Uh %Uh what sort of %uh

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I don't have the slightest idea at the moment.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if you can help me find a really affordable hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, what you have here- are you getting it on the screen now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So do you see the green line at the bottom right-hand side?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you follow the line %uh from the right to the left.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that is where we have maybe the better class hotels.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you follow %uh a little bit further out.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You know where the green line hits the yellow and the red?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You follow the green line %uh up left towards the north.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Orchard is a very popular road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are lots of %uh shops there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you go the other way when you take the train and you go down to- you switch to Clarke Quay, you could actually walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that's near one of our rivers called the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you might want to bar hop there at night.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Affordable as in %uh what sort of price range are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I'll be having a thousand Singaporean dollars with me.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh that will go a long way.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow, so I hope you can help me find a-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you are not looking for luxurious hotels.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: No, not really because we'll just stay out most of the time.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we'll just go there to sleep.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: We just need a place where we can sleep and relax.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh are you also %um- do you mind if the place is a little bit crammed and %uh you know, not so large but %uh in a-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: in a nice place of town.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we just need two beds and %um a decent bathroom.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I don't need a television, that's fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They usually come with a television.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you enjoy staying in Chinatown or Little India?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you know, those %uh what we call ethnic heritage areas.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you step out, you can get Chinese food or Indian food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We also have good class hotels there also.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So long as I can go to the mall I mean just walking distance so I can easily walk if I want to go to a restaurant or if I need to shop.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you're talking about a mall, are you talking about modern shopping centre or we have also street side shopping.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm gonna get you hotels in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's great that I can spend one thousand Singapore dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you would save a lot of money shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because we're worried that we need more than that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's a good news then.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have a good range in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could spend it in one day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could spend it in a week.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If your hotel is not too %uh expensive.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because we're planning to spend our money to, you know, to buy food and clothes and whatever.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just- Okay, are you getting the screen now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: which I think is quite interesting.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I will get you Little India later if you want.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But Chinatown is %uh you know, you can walk out and buy things from the shops.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can also walk to the nearest %uh train station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And get down to Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could walk to your bus by the river.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I can see the %uh I think-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you see Keong Saik Hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I just thought that %uh so have more money shopping.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, I can see you pointing it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh, so that's for ninety dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let's say- well, that's just- These are all %um clean hotels.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do they have good feedback from their customers?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Feedback, you will have to Google maybe and find out.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You see it has only twenty five rooms.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a boutique hotel actually Do you see the hotel description?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what they've done is they converted all shop houses into hotel rooms so the hotel rooms are not %uh very wide.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Perhaps %uh you can get off %uh your hotel room in about fifteen minutes-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: go and have breakfast at the little shops nearby.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you know you could- but the shops open a bit later.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Even the malls, they start up at about ten o'clock in the morning.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But how long would it take if I'll walk- is it possible for us to walk from the hotel to the nearest mall?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you give me the nearest mall in that hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Mall- oh yes, you could walk down to Central Mall which is-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you overlook the Singapore River if you %uh for example have a ice cream in one of the- there's an ice cream boutique there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that- I think I'll take that place then.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That will be perfect so that we can spend our money %um with food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: We can buy more food and clothes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, and you could hang out at the bars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How far is Sentosa from that hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can %uh just walk to the nearest train station-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you can take the train.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you get off at HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there you can take a shuttle into Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %uh can you tell me how much will be- how much do we need to pay for the fare?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I don't have the exact fare it goes by distance.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But what I advise is you get a card when you come in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At Changi Airport, you go to the MRT station and you collect- you pay in advance for a card with stored value.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then before you go back, you'll get your change if you hand it back in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Unless you want it as a souvenir.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you're only paying as a Singaporean would pay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But how much do we need to spend if we'll take the MRT all the time?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um how much do we need to allot for that-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are taking the trains and the buses-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think just maybe twenty dollars or even less.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a- it's because of the deposit you have to pay but you're getting it back once you hand in the card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's for the manufacture of the card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you are not intending to bring it back, you know, %uh it's- it's just the distance travelled and I think you will spend- on travel, maybe only ten dollars or so.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Unless you're travelling all the time and you're not-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: heading off and shopping or eating, you know?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Or probably we can allot a hundred just to be safe for the fare.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No. You don't need so much if you are using buses than train.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The only thing is if you take the train ride round Singapore %um you have- and you get off say one stop from your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you will have to pay a two dollar surcharge.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for using the train for too long because we don't want people to hang out in the trains.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But if we're going out at night, maybe you can suggest some restaurants or bars that we can visit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You are thinking of what kind of food?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm we love to try authentic food from Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you know where you are in Chinatown?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have a very old market that has been spruced up and it's one of my favourite places to eat.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have also Muslim food there and Indian food but people go there for Chinese food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh let me try and see which there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how much do I need to pay for a meal for example?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you add a lot of food, ten dollars will go a long way.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let's say if you bought %uh different things and you tried it on.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Assuming you have a big appetite.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh let me see if I can get this %uh- take a look.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Food centre, let's see, Can you see Maxwell Food Centre there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now it's actually on the edge of the business district and Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it would be within walking distance-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And really, you- even if you stay somewhere else, this is a good place to try %uh local food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you should go there different times of the day because in the morning you will get some stores that only sell up to lunch.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are some open at dinner time and supper time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we've got noodles, we've got rice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh vegetarian stalls and %uh fish soups if you are thinking of something healthy.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you- do you have dietary needs?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: My best friend is always hungry so that- we need to find the perfect restaurant.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Besides going to the market, there would be stalls just outside your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh actually I should tell you that %uh your hotel is located in what %uh maybe eighty years ago was a red light district-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So around that area, there are many %uh food stalls %Uh and %uh coffee shops we call them actually.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Wow, okay, that will be great.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But can you suggest more activities that we can do together aside from malling and eating?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you want to go to %uh you was- you mentioned the beach earlier, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm gonna get Sentosa for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can I- oops just a minute.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How far is Sentosa from our hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, let me get back the- Okay, now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You see where you are, you could walk to the %uh MRT station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you could- are you getting Sentosa on your screen?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I can see it now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So where you are is- let me see- Tanjong Pagar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: About maybe two- just a minute %uh. Let me get on the train.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh right at the bottom on the green line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You go on the green line-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and you go to Outram Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you switch to the North East Line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You just go one stop and you're at HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you can just ask anybody for directions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The bus bay where Sentosa operates shuttle buses into Sentosa on a regular basis.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh or you could take an express then you have to go- that in fact there's a huge shopping area there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are two shopping malls there, VivoCity and HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At VivoCity, on the top floor, you can get an express light rail system direct into Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But the easier way is you just go to the foot, the bus bay because at the bus bay again, you can get a lot of variety of food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Malay- this time you get more of the Malay %uh that means %uh Muslim food and Indian food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's also lot of Chinese stalls, food stalls.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the people who work at HarbourFront at the malls, they often go across the road to where the bus terminal is to get their food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's nice to check it out, you know, check it out first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you still want to take the express train, you could.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could cross the road and you make your way to VivoCity and you can take the train in.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise you can take the shuttle.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think it cost about a dollar only extra on you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But how much do I need to pay if I'll go to Sentosa?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: For the- do you have any entrance fee or do I need to to get there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you'll go and swim, it's just two dollars to enter.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you enter the attractions, then you have to pay more.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I would like to try the cable car.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do I need to pay extra for that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You need to- actually the good thing is to get %uh what do you call it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Get to the top of Mount Faber which is near to HarbourFront.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh buy or- buy a %uh sort of a package.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from the package, you can get lower price entry to all the attractions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh let me show you some of the attractions first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because the- they are packaged in such a way that, you know, if you like adventure.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you take the cable car-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you end up there on the island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Imbiah Lookout is the- is the stop.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's on a little hill.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From there you can walk to the Butterfly Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you could %uh take a little ride, you know, on this little- like sling down the little hill but this is a concrete trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they have a short cable car there but you want to take the main one across the Harbour, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you're there, you can check out all the places there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are- you could walk to the beach from there too.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there's a museum in what used to be %uh former British military hospital converted to museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me see if it's shown here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because Images of Singapore gives you %uh the-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we love to see that as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now on beaches, you'll see what you see now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, and now do you see Universal World?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you like to go to Universal Studios, you could visit that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, like how much do I need to spend for that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you give me an estimate so that I will know how to budget my money?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Maybe I say about fifty dollars or hundred dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can I get Universal Studios for you to get it more accurately/

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because there are rides that you can take there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's why we're not really spending too much for the hotel because we want to go around the city and make the most of it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But two days is a little short.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think you need %uh five days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you stay there, you would use up your thousand dollars very quickly.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No I mean the hotel there would be, you know, more than a hundred dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you went and took these rides then, it would cost more.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think she's not really into casino so that's fine if-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So yes, that would save you a lot of money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So but we're planning to spend the rest of the day in that place in Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: However %um how far is Marina Bay from Sentosa?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you have to get out of Sentosa island first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then %uh you have to take public transport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me try to get you- %uh do you have the map now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So Marina Bay, you're lucky because the train has just %uh connected to Marina Bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you would be at HarbourFront when you're on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you connect with the blue line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could either continue to Dhoby Ghaut and then switch to the red line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: because Dhoby Ghaut is a major interchange and there are lot- there's a huge shopping mall there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you might want to spend some time there before you change to the red line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: and go South to Marina Bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The red line is the newest line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's the circle line but it hasn't, you know %uh it doesn't really form a circle here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um can you suggest some activities that we can do at Marina Bay aside from we can swim as well and %um drink.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What else can we do there?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Anything that is %um fun or exciting.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I don't have the date with me but %uh we can check out that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it for free or do we need to pay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have lunch time concerts but that would be like once a month so-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: it may not coincide with the time you are coming but let me see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they are built like the old style microphones that have the %um the rounded tops So it's like two big caps %uh on the water, let me see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me just see if I can get you some photos here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's nice to just go there and take photos.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there are lot of shops in there too.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um the shops would be not like your Chinatown type.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Very nice place to hang out.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I just booked on the sixteenth.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I don't have the calendar right now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, sixteenth is a Monday and-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I was looking at twenty one.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, that is a- I'm not sure what they have %uh on those dates right now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it much better to stroll in a weekend or weekdays?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is more full of activities.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And when we are celebrating certain festivals like Chinese New Year or the Christmas, there are lots of free performances just in the concourse area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, I'm trying to find it on their own website.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh dear, don't tell me they only gave it for this month.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh I think we need to reschedule our flight.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you- oh you can have a look at- just to get an idea of what is on right now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you have an idea of what we have.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, I'll take note of the website.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And maybe on the first of January you try it when you- %uh first of April I mean.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But what is the peak season in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just like in our country, it's %um around summer time or-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's usually school holiday time for the countries nearby and-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh Singaporeans also travel so- %uh rather move around Singapore's attractions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we just had the school holidays over.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that was one week of busy time at the shopping malls and the-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh April, I think they've all gone back to school.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh it would not be so crowded It would be quite relaxed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Especially on a Monday and Tuesday I think %uh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I find it a little bit too crowded down at Orchard Road on the weekends.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because everybody likes to go there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think it will be perfect.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I will just go there on the sixteenth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh are you getting the schedule now for April?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm afraid the background is black so-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that will be on the sixteenth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's a twelve to- oh no, twelve to-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: There's no event on the sixteenth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's Dance Workshop on the seventeenth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They take a break on Monday.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, so maybe we'll try the next day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, unless you're into dance and dance workshops on the seventeenth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You want me to open this up for you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think we should take that as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the person conducting I think.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are there restrictions in your country like- are we allowed to just stay at- stay out %uh around one A.M. or two A.M. or that's fine if we just stay until- the next day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can stay as long as you like but I don't think %uh Sentosa would like you to sleep on the beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when we have a beach party, they tell people that, you know in the mornings, we have the shuttle buses to go out.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What time will they close then?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh actually I don't know about that, you know?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But maybe the lifeguards will come around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are more worried about safety.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So probably around six or seven in the evening.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh you could stay later than that because we have beach bars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um but you know, being Sentosa, the prices will not be the same as %um let's say Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: if I can get the beach.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I hope they have an event on the sixteenth too.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Ah usually it's on weekends, we have-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is a bit more-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can we do that? Do you have extra activities?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can we do that? Do you have extra activities?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You could but frankly %uh you would have to take a trip to the island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh one of our outer islands to do snorkelling %uh. There's not much underwater wildlife on that beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I mean it's merely for swimming.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh because that's what we want to do.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So can you suggest a place where we can go snorkelling?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me see %uh. You would need to go with %uh somebody who organises it I would suggest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I also think you should stay longer because otherwise- it's one whole day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, it's okay if we'll stay there for the whole day and then we can just shop the next day because our flight is at night.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we can maximise our time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no, I'm afraid the organisers in Singapore organise for outside Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There is one place %uh. At Sisters Island but the waters there are quite rough.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I'm not sure because I don't snorkel myself %uh. Or rather I- %uh frankly I don't snorkel in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, because over there, it's too rough for me huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I got to snorkel in very shallow water.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I have to go to places where the fish come up to your feet, you know %uh in very little water.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you give me an estimate let's say if I'll take advantage of this service or this package?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that I'll have an idea how much do I need to save for this?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You need to hire a boat and %uh wait %uh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me try to see if they have it somewhere else here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: 'Cause I don't want to give you- wait, sorry.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But I heard that if you really want to shop %um nice gadgets or affordable gadgets we can just go to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes %uh. You should bring extra money if you are buying like %uh-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Lap- you know if you are buying laptops or you are buying something expensive then, you know, your thousand dollars will not %uh accommodate that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I have a niece who go snorkelling.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You should try that too, that's fun

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh no. It's- the island I'm referring to is too dangerous for me, I know.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Or maybe the tourist guide can just help us.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and I have friends who go %uh surveying.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They're actually doing it for nature.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the waters frankly in Singapore are not so clear.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The variety I'm told is good for Singapore waters.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think we just need to skip snorkelling and we just need to go around the city and try some food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes %uh I have to be frank with you %um.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can use Singapore as a base to maybe Indonesia or Malaysia and try snorkelling there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you are, you know, very keen on seeing- if you like- you need to see the fish right in your eye.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But if I want to buy some gadgets, where should I go?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Hm what are you thinking of buying actually?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think my best friend, she wants to buy a new laptop.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Laptop, I suggest you go to this place called Funan Centre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are they on sale next month?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Will they be on sale next month?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: let me get into the website.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Usually what I advise people to do is to- okay, you have a picture of the mall there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Go to the various shops and ask for the price of the item you want to buy and tell them frankly that you are price checking so they will give you the best price.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then after you walk around, you can come back to the first shop.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think we should go there as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how far is that from our hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How long would it take for us to reach that area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Hm you said you are good at walking, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Would that take us for an hour or-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, I think maybe forty minutes or thirty minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or you could %um get on the street that is %uh facing the direction out of your hotel, the main street.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And just take a bus maybe two stops and you would be there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But I'm just curious %um how much do I need to pay if I'll take the cab?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I notice that you've been suggesting that I should take the MRT or- because-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Cabs are about three dollars upwards.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Three twenty upwards %uh and it's a- we have some surcharges if you leave early in the morning like when everyone is going to office.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But because we have the buses running also full steam and the trains they agreed- if you miss the train this morning, it was two minutes before the next train came.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think it's really- it's also more fun for you, you know?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You'll get to see the local people.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like you- I have told you, it's so well connected.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You have lots of buses, lots of trains.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The taxis %uh in Chinatown, you have to go to a taxi stop %uh to pick the taxi.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um is it safe to take the cab or the MRT instead?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes %uh it's as safe in both.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You just don't take all your bling and hang it all around you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I don't think you'll be doing that, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That %uh- like I said you can't- you can book the cab from your hotel or you can get reception to call you a cab.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you are sort of walking around Chinatown, you need to find a cab station, you know, a taxi stand to get your cab.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are not allowed to stop any and everywhere.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But I'm just wondering if you can suggest a place where I can buy souvenirs?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Chinatown would be the best place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there are street stalls and there are also shops.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But like I said, you might want to walk around the whole place first.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But usually in Chinatown, they are more or less the same price for the cheap souvenirs like three items for ten dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there would be different sort of items.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think %um you were able to answer my questions and thank you for being patient because I have- I asked you a lot of questions today.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm very sorry I can't %uh give you better news on snorkelling.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: but you can come to Singapore and use the services of the companies that organise for Singaporeans to go snorkelling nearby.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You know, and it would not be expensive, you know?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But %um can you give me some tips or what are the things that I should remember if I go to your country so that the police will not call my attention or-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you give me some tips that- I mean the things that I need to remember so that, you know, I will not commit mistakes or- nothing bad will happen if I go there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like I know that we can't chew gums and we can't smoke everywhere so what else maybe?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can chew gum in Singapore, you just cannot import gum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's the miscon- you can bring in gum but if you brought in a whole carton %uh the customs would- will take it away from you because they will assume you are selling it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you bring gum for two days and say it's for my personal use, I don't think anyone will stop you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the only thing is when you dispose of your gum you have to make sure it's wrapped up and thrown in a bin.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or some people carry a little plastic bag and put it in the handbag until they find a proper dustbin to throw it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you also- some tourist carry a little- do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So, you know, they have a little gadget for holding your ashes when you are smoking.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I've seen a tourist used it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I thought it was very cute.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You- so that you can smoke %uh at designated areas but if there's no bin to dispose of your cigarette after you smoke you just keep it back in the container.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just so that you don't break the Anti-Littering Law.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Although most of the time, nobody gets caught.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh Singapore may not be as clean as you imagine it to be.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the restaurants also %uh they have a restriction on the place where you can %uh eat and smoke.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it will be clearly marked out.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you have to seat in that area which means if there are only 3 tables and they are taken then you have to go to a non-smoking area and you cannot smoke there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So great and thank you for helping me, Jeanne and I think one thousand dollars will be enough for me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Right, maybe we just need to bring extra money then.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Bring extra money for shopping, is it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there- you still have some time with me so if you want to ask anything else.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh shall I go to some other sites for you?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm going to Clarke Quay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm just curious how much do we need to pay if we'll drink.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm not sure if it's Tuesday or Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Some bars have a women's night.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The only thing is you have to dress like a woman.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They have %uh refused to let some women in who were dressed %uh not like women if you get what I mean.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Did they get discounts too, Senior Citizens?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, they- you see, they want the ladies to attract the men there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, the ladies get in for free.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Usually the cover charge is maybe twenty dollars or-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: a weekday is lower than %uh weekends.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh let me try and get it here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And lunch- a lunch at Clarke Quay unless they have changed it, it's only about fifteen plus.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I've done a walk there myself and %uh I was very tempted to go in and eat.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I don't know how you- oh you got to be a certified then.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, yes, I can see it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you have your driver's license.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The whole jug at thirty dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Usually it's the Wednesday night that's on- Wednesdays and Thursdays.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright, so let's see if we can still adjust the flight.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that we can take advantage of the ladies night, Wednesdays.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Hm and I suggest you stay a little bit longer because it will allow you to see more things.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So maybe one thousand will really help me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: One thousand dollars will be really good for us.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I bet my best that I'll bring extra money to get the most of it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You- you may- Yes, for your shopping and %uh you might have extra money to go home.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or you could, you know, fill up with your shopping.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me see if I can get Orchard Road shops for you %huh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Will it be really hot next month in your country?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um it's hot and sometimes wet throughout the year.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So yes, my advice is to bring a cardigan more for the, you know, if you go in the bars, sometimes they're cold or the restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or the air conditioning within %uh certain areas.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The outside area would not be hot- %uh would not be cold.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Although %uh these few months, we had some cold evenings which is very nice if you enjoy walking out in the open.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So in the evening times, many people go out and walk because they find it- well, firstly if they work in day, they have time only in the evenings.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so here you see a scene of the light up.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you come to see the light up.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But at the time you come, you can- we are now linking up the shops in Orchard Road so %um it's not hundred per cent connected but like maybe eighty per cent.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can walk from mall to mall without getting wet.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And as you say you enjoy walking-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have the high-end , Gucci.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have also in bet- in some other shopping centres, we have %uh non-branded items.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So maybe we can just take pictures.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like I said there are shops %uh that are not Gucci and Cartier.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um have you heard of things like G2000?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think we also have that store in this- in our country.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can buy your souvenir t-shirts in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think that will be all for today, Jeanne.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And thank you for helping me and I was able to find a very cheap hotel so- perfect.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I hope you'll come and %uh stay a few more days.
